content.description: This route is on the southern (downhill) side of the boulder. SDS just to the right of the wide crack on the left side of the boulder with your feet under the scoopy/ mini-overhang. Start on 2 downpullish holds about a foot apart. Move your right hand up to a small, horizontal crack, get your left hand up to to a sidepull/downpull, then bump your left hand up a big move to another downpull. Match your hands on the rail, then work the topout. The hand crack to the left is off.
content.protection: This is fine without a pad, and a jacket is nice to keep the feet from getting dusty. It has a flat landing.
content.location: It is on the left side of the road, off of S. Columbine Rd., right before you get to the turnoff for Elaine Rd.
